question: When the Supreme Court of India tenders advice to the President on a matter of law or fact?
option2: only if he seeks such advice
option3: only if the matter relates to the Fundamental Rights of citizens
option4: only if the issue poses a threat to the unity and integrity of the country
answer: only if he seeks such advice
explanation: Article 143 of the Indian Constitution confers upon the Supreme Court advisory jurisdiction. The President may seek the opinion of the Supreme Court on any question of law or fact of public importance on which he thinks it expedient to obtain such an opinion.
